answers.answer: I hear some women on here said it worked for them.  It never worked for me but I heard there are other benefits besides inducing labour from it. But I can't remember what they were ,  something about helping preparing your cervix I think.

I guess I will try some. I like tea anyway since the weather is changing. I have gestational diabetes and my baby is measuring big. I have another u/s on Weds to be sure that I can have a vaginal delivery.
It does not induce labour at all. It tones your uterus so that when labour starrts an you get contractions they are more effectful.
I personally would try a ton of walking first!!! If baby is ready the walking would speed things up!

It wont bring on labour but strengthens ur uterus. ur meant to start taking it between 32-34wk to get it in ur system for labour. it wont wont if ur due date is close or gone. im 35wk n not takin it but my friend is who is 36wk n sed ot gives her strong braxton hicks wen she drinks it.

smybax and ftmkelowna made great posts. just want to add that you should research it before deciding, everyone is different and has different comfort zones. you have to take it several times a day too for it to work and steep it accordingly.personally i enjoyed my raspberry leaf tea experience. and i plan to do it again for this pregnancy.its also great to help your uterus shrink back to size after.hope you have a good experience too

The cold kind that is already premade doesnt work...I went to an Organic Store and bought all natural Red Raspberry Leaf Tea, and almost went into preterm labor!! So now im waiting til im term to drink it! it worked for me lmao

question: Rumor has it that Raspberry Leaf Tea will help naturally induce labor. Is this fact or fiction?
title: Anyone Tried Raspberry leaf Tea?
